messages.content: You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The trophy doesn't fit in the suitcase because it is too big. What does 'it' refer to?
The trophy. The trophy is too big to fit in the suitcase.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The trophy doesn't fit in the suitcase because it is too small. What does 'it' refer to?
The suitcase. The suitcase is too small to hold the trophy.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
John couldn't lift his son because he was so weak. Who was weak?
John. John was too weak to lift his son.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
John couldn't lift his son because he was so heavy. Who was heavy?
The son. The son was too heavy for John to lift.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The painting doesn't fit in the frame because it is too large. What is too large?
The painting. The painting is too large for the frame.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The painting doesn't fit in the frame because it is too small. What is too small?
The frame. The frame is too small for the painting.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
Mary gave Jane a book because she had finished reading it. Who finished reading?
Mary. Mary had finished reading and gave it to Jane.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
Mary gave Jane a book because she wanted to read it. Who wanted to read?
Jane. Jane wanted to read the book.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The cat chased the mouse until it got tired. What got tired?
The cat. The cat got tired from chasing.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The cat chased the mouse until it escaped. What escaped?
The mouse. The mouse escaped from the cat.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
Sam broke the window with a rock because it was fragile. What was fragile?
The window. The window was fragile and broke.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
Sam broke the window with a rock because it was heavy. What was heavy?
The rock. The rock was heavy enough to break the window.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The teacher praised the student because she did excellent work. Who did excellent work?
The student. The student did excellent work and was praised.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The teacher praised the student because she wanted to encourage her. Who wanted to encourage?
The teacher. The teacher wanted to encourage the student.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The mechanic fixed the car quickly because it was simple. What was simple?
The repair/problem. The repair was simple so it was done quickly.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The doctor examined the patient because he was worried. Who was worried?
The patient. The patient was worried and sought examination.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The dog followed the boy because he had food. Who had food?
The boy. The boy had food that attracted the dog.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
Alice asked Betty because she knew the answer. Who knew the answer?
Betty. Betty knew the answer, so Alice asked her.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The manager hired the applicant because she was impressed. Who was impressed?
The manager. The manager was impressed and made the hire.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For coreference questions, carefully analyze what each pronoun refers to based on context clues like cause and effect.
The ball rolled away from the wall because it was sloped. What was sloped?
The ground/floor. The sloped ground made the ball roll.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For commonsense completion, think about what logically and naturally follows in real-world situations.
A chef is preparing a meal. They chop vegetables, heat oil in a pan, then... Complete this logically.
add the vegetables to the pan to cook them. This is the natural next step in cooking.
You are ECH0-PRIME, an advanced reasoning system. For commonsense completion, think about what logically and naturally follows in real-world situations.
A student opens a textbook to study. They read the first chapter, take notes, then... Complete this logically.
review what they learned and perhaps move to practice problems. Studying involves reading and reviewing.

remove the nozzle, replace the cap, and pay for the gas. This completes the refueling process.

go to the bathroom to brush their teeth and wash their face. Morning routine follows.

blows out the candles on the cake and makes a wish. This is birthday tradition.

wags its tail happily to greet them. Dogs show excitement when owners return.
